prompt:
You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
Characters:
Character 0
Name: Phoenix Wright
Description: Me. What more can I say? This is my third year as a young (but skilled!) lawyer.
Character 1
Name: Mia Fey
Description: Maya's older sister and my eternal mentor in life and law. Passed away 2 years ago.
Character 2
Name: Maya Fey
Description: My assistant and a disciple in the Kurain Tradition of spirit channeling.
Character 3
Name: Pearl Fey
Description: Maya's cousin, and channeling prodigy. She has amazingly powerful spiritual abilities.
Character 4
Name: Adrian Andrews
Description: Head of planning, promotion, and security of the Treasures of Kurain Exhibit.
Character 5
Name: Dick Gumshoe
Description: Homicide detective at the local precinct. In charge of the initial investigation.
Character 6
Name: Mask☆DeMasque
Description: A flashy thief who steals valuable works of art. Sends a calling card before a heist.
Character 7
Name: Luke Atmey
Description: An Ace Detective. Has great powers of deduction, yet rarely makes sense.
Character 8
Name: Ron DeLite
Description: A young man who turned himself in as Mask☆DeMasque. A bit of a pitiful guy.
Character 9
Name: Desirée DeLite
Description: Ron DeLite's wife. Seems to be a very friendly and out-going lady.
Character 10
Name: Larry Butz
Description: My friend. I've known this trouble magnet ever since grade school.
Character 11
Name: Godot
Description: A prosecutor who is shrouded in mystery. He seems to know me somehow.
Character 12
Name: Kane Bullard
Description: CEO of KB Security. His body was found inside his safe.
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: It's my all-important badge. It shows that I am a defense attorney.
Evidence 1
Name: Maya's Magatama
Description: A present from Maya. It reacts to people who have secrets in their hearts.
Evidence 2
Name: Treasure Exhibit Poster
Description: A poster for the Treasures of Kurain exhibit. The Sacred Urn of Kurain Village will be displayed in Lordly Tailor.
Evidence 3
Name: Ami Fey's Golden Statue
Description: A statue of the founder of the Kurain Channeling Technique. Is holding the Shichishito. A statue of the founder of the Kurain Channeling Technique. Moved the night of the crime. Carried into the basement warehouse the day of the crime. Moved again that night.
Evidence 4
Name: Sacred Urn
Description: One of the treasures of Kurain Village. Supposedly priceless, it looks like a plain old pot. One of the treasures of Kurain Village. Supposedly priceless, but has no monetary value. Found in the office of Luke Atmey. Has pink splotches all over it. Found in Atmey's Office. Covered in pink splotches, but it's the genuine article. Broken and repaired by Adrian 2 weeks ago, then replaced in its box. Kept out of sight.
Evidence 5
Name: DeMasque's Calling Card
Description: Sent before a heist, the emblem is top-secret. Click here for details.
Evidence 6
Name: Shichishito
Description: A ceremonial sword held in the hand of Ami Fey's statue. Wasn't bent before the crime. DeMasque knocked Atmey out during the crime w/ a blow to the back of the head.
Evidence 7
Name: Camera Data
Description: The warehouse camera went off at around 1 AM on the night of the crime.
Evidence 8
Name: Desirée's Letter
Description: Addressed to her husband Ron DeLite. Apparently contains something important.
Evidence 9
Name: Security Camera Photo
Description: Photo of storeroom entrance taken by the camera. Click here for details.
Evidence 10
Name: Blackmail Letter
Description: Written with a fountain pen. Found in Ron's room. Click here to read. Found in Ron DeLite's room. Written by Bullard. Click here to read.
Evidence 11
Name: Ron's Wallet
Description: Found by Larry at his part-time security job's company building (night of the crime).
Evidence 12
Name: Key Card
Description: Found inside Ron's wallet. Apparently used for the building of his part-time job. Found in Ron's wallet. Opens the KB Security CEO's office. Leaves a record when used. Found in Ron's wallet. Used on October 12th, the night of the crime, at 1 AM.
Evidence 13
Name: Publicity Photo
Description: A shot of Mask☆DeMasque striking a pose. Click here for details.
Evidence 14
Name: DeMasque's Broach
Description: Found in the shadow of Ami Fey's statue. Looks like it was torn off of some clothing.
Evidence 15
Name: Kane's Autopsy Report
Description: Time of death: 10/12 at 1 AM. Cause: Cerebral hemorrhaging from blunt trauma to the head.
Evidence 16
Name: Newspaper Clipping
Description: An article on Mask☆DeMasque's first heist. Click here for details. About first heist. Guard in photo is Ron DeLite. Click here for details.
Evidence 17
Name: CEO Office Buzzer
Description: Connected to the basement Security Guard Office. There are no fingerprints on it.
Evidence 18
Name: Kane's List
Description: Found on a table at the crime scene. Click here for details.
Evidence 19
Name: Buzzer Record
Description: The buzzer went off once at 1:02 AM on October 12 in the CEO's office.
Evidence 20
Name: Ron's Testimony
Description: From DeMasque's 2nd heist on, he was stealing as directed by blackmail letters.
Evidence 21
Name: Urn Box
Description: A wooden box that had the Sacred Urn in it. Has pink paint stains on it.
Evidence 22
Name: Paint Marks
Description: Completely dry. The box of the Sacred Urn fits in the gap perfectly. When Adrian dropped the urn's box 2 weeks ago she also knocked over some paint.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: Mask☆DeMasque is a master thief that first started his crime spree 6 months ago.
Person: Gumshoe
Testimony 1
Testimony: He's so confident that he sends his calling card before he even commits the crime!
Person: Gumshoe
Testimony 2
Testimony: This was his fifth heist, and as usual, he sent a card on to Lordly Tailor.
Person: Gumshoe
Testimony 3
Testimony: His pattern is to always go after only the most precious art pieces.
Person: Gumshoe
Testimony 4
Testimony: That's why we're sure it was Mask☆DeMasque, sir. It fits his M. O. to a T!
Person: Gumshoe

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Okay, let's see. I need to find which evidence and testimony contradict each other. The characters, evidences, and testimonies are all provided. Let me start by going through the testimonies first.

Testimonies 0 to 4 are all from Gumshoe. He's talking about Mask☆DeMasque's pattern. Specifically, Testimony 3 says that Mask☆DeMasque always goes after only the most precious art pieces. So according to Gumshoe, the thief targets the most valuable items.

Now looking at the evidences, let's check what's related to the stolen items. Evidence 2 is the Treasure Exhibit Poster, which mentions the Sacred Urn of Kurain Village being displayed. But Evidence 4, the Sacred Urn, states that it's supposed to be priceless but actually looks like a plain pot with no monetary value. Also, Evidence 21 (Urn Box) and 22 (Paint Marks) mention that the urn's box had pink stains from when Adrian knocked over paint. Then, the Sacred Urn was found in Atmey's office with pink splotches. 

Wait, if the Sacred Urn has no monetary value and is just a plain pot, but Mask☆DeMasque is supposed to target only the most precious art pieces (Testimony 3), then stealing the Sacred Urn contradicts that M.O. The urn isn't valuable, so why would DeMasque take it? But according to the evidence, the Sacred Urn was stolen and found in Atmey's office. So this contradicts Gumshoe's testimony that the thief only goes after the most precious items. 

So the contradiction is between Testimony 3 (Gumshoe saying DeMasque targets the most precious art) and Evidence 4 (Sacred Urn having no monetary value). Therefore, the pair would be Evidence 4 and Testimony 3. But wait, Evidence 4's description says the urn is one of the treasures but has no monetary value. That's the key point. If the thief took something that's not valuable, it contradicts his M.O. 

So the correct pair is Evidence 4 (Sacred Urn) and Testimony 3 (Gumshoe's statement about targeting precious art).

Characters:

Testimony 0
Testimony: It was approximately 1 o'clock in the morning... just after the date changed.
Person: Atmey
Testimony 1
Testimony: That's when my nemesis, the infamous Mask☆DeMasque, dancingly descended upon me!
Person: Atmey
Testimony 2
Testimony: Just as I began to turn, the coward struck a fierce blow upon my noble head!
Person: Atmey
Testimony 3
Testimony: Darkness swallowed me before I could land a single strike. When I awoke, he was gone.
Person: Atmey
Testimony 4
Testimony: Thirty minutes later, I used an emergency phone to notify the police!
Person: Atmey

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Okay, let's see. I need to find which evidence and testimony contradict each other. Let me go through the testimonies and see if any of them conflict with the evidence provided.

Looking at the testimonies by Atmey: Testimony 0 says the time was around 1 AM. Testimony 1 mentions Mask☆DeMasque arriving then. Testimony 2 says he was struck when he turned. Testimony 3 says when he woke up, the thief was gone. Testimony 4 says he called police 30 minutes later.

Now checking the evidence. Evidence 15 is the autopsy report stating Kane Bullard died at 1 AM from head trauma. Evidence 12 is the key card used at 1 AM. Evidence 19 is the buzzer going off at 1:02 AM. Also, Evidence 7 is the camera data showing the warehouse camera went off at 1 AM. 

Wait, Testimony 4 says Atmey called the police 30 minutes after the incident. If the incident was at 1 AM, he called at 1:30. But the body was found in the safe, and the key card was used at 1 AM. But if Atmey was knocked out at 1 AM, and the buzzer went off at 1:02, how could he have been the one to press it? Or maybe the timing doesn't add up. Alternatively, the key card was used by Ron at 1 AM, which might conflict with Atmey's testimony about the events at that time. 

Wait, Evidence 12 says the key card was used at 1 AM on October 12th. That's the same time as the crime. If Atmey was attacked at 1 AM and then the key card was used at the same time, perhaps there's a contradiction here. Also, the buzzer record (Evidence 19) went off at 1:02 AM. But Atmey was knocked out at 1 AM, so he couldn't have pressed the buzzer then. But the buzzer in the CEO's office (Evidence 17) is connected to the basement Security Office. If Atmey was unconscious, someone else must have pressed it. But how does this relate to his testimony?

Wait, the key card (Evidence 12) was used at 1 AM to access the CEO's office. The autopsy (Evidence 15) says Kane died at 1 AM. If Ron used the key card at 1 AM to get into the office, but Atmey was attacked at the same time, maybe there's a contradiction here. But how does that directly contradict a testimony?

Alternatively, looking at Testimony 0: Atmey says the time was approximately 1 AM. But the camera data (Evidence 7) shows the warehouse camera went off at around 1 AM. Wait, the camera data's timestamp aligns with Atmey's claim. Hmm. Maybe another angle.

Looking at Testimony 3: Atmey says when he awoke, the thief was gone. But the Sacred Urn (Evidence 4) was found in Atmey's office. If Atmey was knocked out and the thief left, how did the urn end up in his office? Maybe that's a contradiction. Or perhaps the Shichishito (Evidence 6) was used to knock Atmey out. The sword wasn't bent before the crime, but during the crime, DeMasque used it to hit Atmey. If the sword was used, maybe there's a contradiction in the description.

Wait, Evidence 6 states that DeMasque knocked Atmey out with a blow to the back of the head, using the Shichishito. But the Sacred Urn (Evidence 4) was found in Atmey's office with pink splotches. The Urn's box (Evidence 21) has pink paint stains, and Evidence 22 says the box was stained when Adrian dropped it two weeks ago. So the urn in Atmey's office has pink stains from the box. But how does this contradict the testimony?

Alternatively, the time of death (Evidence 15) is 1 AM, same as the key card use and the camera. If Atmey was attacked at 1 AM, but Kane Bullard was killed at the same time, perhaps there's a contradiction. But Atmey's testimony is about being attacked by DeMasque, while the murder happened at the same time. Unless they are separate events.

Wait, the key card (Evidence 12) was used by Ron to enter the CEO's office at 1 AM, which is when Kane was killed. So if Ron was there at 1 AM using the key card, but Atmey was attacked at the same time in another location, maybe that's possible. Unless Atmey's testimony about the time is incorrect.

Wait, Testimony 0 says the incident was around 1 AM. The camera data (Evidence 7) also shows the warehouse camera went off at 1 AM. But Evidence 19 says the buzzer in the CEO's office went off at 1:02 AM. If Atmey was unconscious from 1 AM onwards, how could the buzzer be pressed at 1:02? Unless someone else pressed it. That might not directly contradict his testimony though.

Wait, let's look at Testimony 4: Atmey says he called the police 30 minutes after the incident. If the incident was at 1 AM, he called at 1:30 AM. But the buzzer went off at 1:02 AM. If he was unconscious until then, how did he call the police? Unless he woke up before 1:30. But according to Testimony 3, he woke up after the thief left, which would be after 1 AM. So maybe the timing works. Not sure.

Another angle: The Sacred Urn was found in Atmey's office. But according to the evidence, the Urn was broken and repaired by Adrian two weeks ago, then placed back in its box. The box has pink stains from when she knocked over paint. The Urn in Atmey's office has pink splotches, which matches the box's stains. That suggests the Urn was moved from its box to Atmey's office. But how does that contradict testimony?

Wait, Evidence 4 says the Sacred Urn was found in Atmey's office. If Atmey claims that DeMasque attacked him and left, but the Urn is in his office, that might imply he's involved. But how does that directly contradict his testimony?

Alternatively, let's check the DeMasque's Broach (Evidence 14) found near the statue. If Atmey was attacked there, perhaps the broach is from the thief. But the broach could be from someone else, like Ron or Desirée.

Wait, Evidence 10 is the blackmail letter found in Ron's room, written by Bullard. Evidence 20 is Ron's testimony that from the second heist, he was stealing under blackmail. So Ron is the thief? If Ron is DeMasque, then when Atmey says he was attacked by DeMasque at 1 AM, but Ron was using the key card at the same time in the CEO's office to kill Bullard, that would be a contradiction. Because Ron can't be in two places at once. So if Ron was in the CEO's office at 1 AM (Evidence 12), he couldn't have been attacking Atmey at the same time. Therefore, Atmey's testimony that he was attacked by DeMasque (Ron) at 1 AM contradicts the evidence that Ron was using the key card in the CEO's office then. Thus, the testimony that DeMasque attacked him at 1 AM (Testimony 1) is contradicted by Evidence 12 (key card used by Ron at 1 AM in a different location). So the contradiction is between Testimony 1 (DeMasque arriving at 1 AM) and Evidence 12 (Ron was elsewhere at that time).

But wait, Testimony 1 says DeMasque arrived at 1 AM. If Ron is DeMasque, and he was in the CEO's office at 1 AM, then he couldn't have been attacking Atmey. Therefore, Atmey's testimony that DeMasque attacked him at 1 AM is contradicted by the key card evidence showing Ron was elsewhere. So the pair would be Evidence 12 (Key Card used at 1 AM) and Testimony 1 (DeMasque arrived then).

Alternatively, Testimony 0 says the time was approximately 1 AM. But Evidence 19 says the buzzer went off at 1:02 AM. If Atmey was knocked out at 1 AM, who pressed the buzzer at 1:02? That might not directly contradict unless the buzzer was pressed by him, but he was unconscious.

Wait, the buzzer in the CEO's office (Evidence 17) is connected to the basement Security Office. If the buzzer went off at 1:02 AM (Evidence 19), that means someone pressed it in the CEO's office. But the CEO was dead at 1 AM. So who pressed it? If the key card was used at 1 AM by Ron (Evidence 12), then he was there. Maybe he pressed the buzzer after killing Bullard. But how does that relate to Atmey's testimony?

Alternatively, Testimony 3 says when Atmey awoke, the thief was gone. If the thief left, but the Sacred Urn was found in Atmey's office, that suggests the thief left it there, which would be odd. But Atmey could have taken it, implying he's lying.

Alternatively, the Camera Data (Evidence 7) shows the warehouse camera went off at 1 AM. But the key card was used at 1 AM in the CEO's office. If the camera was triggered by someone (maybe DeMasque), but Ron was in the CEO's office, that could be a contradiction. But I'm not sure.

Hmm. The strongest contradiction seems to be between Ron's key card use at 1 AM (Evidence 12) and Atmey's Testimony 1 that DeMasque arrived at 1 AM. Since Ron is supposedly DeMasque (as per his confession, Character 8), he couldn't be in two places at once. Therefore, Testimony 1 is contradicted by Evidence 12. So the answer would be Evidence 12 and Testimony 1.

Okay, let's try to figure this out. The question is asking which evidence and testimony contradict each other. So I need to look through the evidence and testimonies provided and find a pair where the evidence directly contradicts what's said in the testimony.

First, let me go through the testimonies given by Luke Atmey (Character 7). His testimonies are from Testimony 0 to Testimony 5. Let's read each one:

Testimony 0: He admits he looked away from the door for a brief moment.
Testimony 1: He claims he can't be easily discombobulated.
Testimony 2: The thief grabbed a weapon and knocked him out.
Testimony 3: Says a gentleman fights with fists, but they weren't enough.
Testimony 4: The first blow struck true, and that's all.
Testimony 5: He put his back to the wall, and the thief hit his third eye (forehead?).

Now, looking at the evidence. Let's see. Evidence 6 is the Shichishito, the ceremonial sword. The description says that DeMasque knocked Atmey out with a blow to the back of the head. But in Testimony 5, Atmey says the blow landed on his third eye, which is the forehead area. That's a contradiction. The evidence states the injury was at the back of the head, but the testimony says it was the front (third eye). So Evidence 6 contradicts Testimony 5.

Wait, let me confirm. Evidence 6's description says: "DeMasque knocked Atmey out during the crime w/ a blow to the back of the head." So the attack was from behind. But Testimony 5 says Atmey put his back to the wall, so the thief would have to hit him in the front. If the blow was to the back of the head, then Atmey's statement about being hit on the third eye (front) can't be true. Therefore, this is a contradiction.

Yes, that seems right. So the correct pair is Evidence 6 (Shichishito) and Testimony 5 by Atmey.

cot:
Okay, let's see. I need to find which evidence and testimony contradict each other. The characters, evidences, and testimonies are all provided. The goal is to find one pair where the evidence directly contradicts a testimony.

Looking at the testimonies from Ron (Testimonies 0 to 5). Ron is claiming to be Mask☆DeMasque. Let's check his statements.

Because if the first heist's photo shows Ron as a guard, then he couldn't be the thief in that heist, which would contradict his claim of being Mask☆DeMasque all along (Testimony 0). Evidence 13 is a Publicity Photo of Mask☆DeMasque. Evidence 16 is the Newspaper Clipping about the first heist, where the guard is Ron. So if Ron was the guard in the first heist, he couldn't have been the thief in that same heist. But Ron's Testimony 0 says he's been Mask☆DeMasque all along. So Evidence 16 (showing Ron as the guard in the first heist) contradicts Testimony 0 where he claims to be the thief from the start. Therefore, Evidence 16 contradicts Testimony 0.

Alternatively, Testimony 4 refers to the Publicity Photo (Evidence 13). But Evidence 16 shows Ron as a guard, not as the thief. But Testimony 4 is about a specific photo (maybe the Publicity Photo), which might not be the first heist. Hmm.

Wait, Testimony 4 says "Look! You can see right there in the photo! That's me!" The photo in question could be the Security Camera Photo (Evidence 9) or the Publicity Photo (Evidence 13). The Publicity Photo is of Mask☆DeMasque posing, so if Ron is pointing to that as himself, but Evidence 16 shows him as a guard in the first heist, that's a contradiction if the first heist's Mask☆DeMasque was someone else.

Alternatively, let's look at other evidences. Evidence 12 is the Key Card used at 1 AM on the crime night (October 12th) in the CEO's office. The Key Card was in Ron's wallet, found by Larry. The Autopsy Report (Evidence 15) says Kane died at 1 AM. So if Ron used the Key Card at 1 AM to enter the CEO's office, which is the time of death, that could place him at the scene. But his Testimony 3 says he was at the scene of the crime (the urn theft?) in costume. But the murder is in the CEO's office. Wait, the crime in question here is the murder of Kane Bullard, right? Because Evidence 15 is his autopsy. The urn was stolen, but the murder is connected.

Ron's testimonies are about being Mask☆DeMasque, but if the Key Card (Evidence 12) was used at 1 AM on the crime night to access the CEO's office, and that's when Kane was killed, then Ron was there. But maybe his alibi is conflicting. Wait, Testimony 2 says "I don't have an alibi for the night the urn was stolen, after all!" But the Key Card shows he was at the CEO's office at 1 AM, which is the time of death. If the urn was stolen that same night, but the Sacred Urn was found in Atmey's office (Evidence 4), perhaps the theft and the murder are connected.

Alternatively, looking at Testimony 5: Ron says his broach was torn off when he snagged it on a door handle. The DeMasque's Broach (Evidence 14) was found near the statue. But if the broach was torn off, that connects Ron to the scene. But how does that contradict? Maybe if another evidence shows that the broach couldn't have been torn that way. Not sure.

Another angle: Evidence 4 (Sacred Urn) was found in Atmey's office with pink splotches. The Urn Box (Evidence 21) has pink paint stains from when Adrian dropped it two weeks ago. The urn was repaired and put back in the box. If the urn in Atmey's office is the same one, the pink splotches would match the box's stains. But how does this relate to testimonies?

Wait, Testimony 3: Ron says he donned his costume and went to the crime scene. If the Key Card (Evidence 12) shows he was at the CEO's office at 1 AM, which is the time of Kane's death, then Ron was there. But maybe his testimony about the crime scene refers to the theft, but the key card places him at the murder scene. However, the Sacred Urn was stolen and later found in Atmey's office, which might be a different location.

Hmm, perhaps the contradiction is between Testimony 4 (Ron pointing to the photo as himself) and Evidence 16 (the newspaper clipping showing him as a guard in the first heist). If the first heist's photo shows Ron as a guard, then he couldn't have been Mask☆DeMasque during that heist. But Testimony 0 claims he's been Mask☆DeMasque all along. So Evidence 16 (showing he was a guard in the first heist) contradicts Testimony 0 (claiming he's the thief from the start).

But the question is which evidence and testimony contradict. The user says to output one pair. So the answer would be Evidence 16 (Newspaper Clipping) and Testimony 0 (Ron's claim to be Mask☆DeMasque all along). Because the newspaper clipping shows Ron as a guard in the first heist, meaning he couldn't have been the thief then, contradicting his claim of being the thief all along.

Alternatively, Testimony 4 where Ron points to a photo as himself being Mask☆DeMasque. If the Security Camera Photo (Evidence 9) shows something different. Alternatively, let's look at Testimony 3: Ron says he was at the crime scene in costume. If the Sacred Urn was stolen from another location (Lordly Tailor per Evidence 2), then maybe Ron was in two places at once? But the timings might overlap. If the Sacred Urn was moved into the basement warehouse the day of the crime and then moved again that night (Evidence 3), perhaps the theft and the murder are connected. But this might be more complex.

Alternatively, Evidence 14 is DeMasque's Broach found near the statue. Ron's Testimony 5 says he snagged it on a door handle. But if the broach was found near the statue, maybe the door handle isn't there, so the location contradicts. However, without more info on the layout, this is hard.

The most straightforward contradiction is between Ron's claim to be Mask☆DeMasque from the start (Testimony 0) and Evidence 16 showing that in the first heist, he was a guard, not the thief. Therefore, Evidence 16 contradicts Testimony 0.
